events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle on the highway causing significant damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the reported car collision incident.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to ensure proper handling and communication with the claimant.
The claim acknowledgement message was sent to the customer confirming receipt and initiation of the process.
The claimant was requested to submit police reports, vehicle registration, and photos of the accident damages.
The customer promptly submitted all required documents including accident photos and police report for review.
An investigation team began assessing the submitted documents and contacted witnesses to verify the accident details.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and the damages were consistent with the collision description.
A settlement proposal covering vehicle repair costs and towing fees was sent to the customer for approval.
The customer provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with timely communication and proposed settlement.
The claim was officially approved following the customer's acceptance of the settlement terms and conditions.
The payment covering the vehicle repairs was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account without delay.
The auto accident claim was closed after payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion by the insured.
The claim file was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference if necessary.
